intro: Melampyrum laxum var. yakusimense, commonly known as Yakusim yellowtop, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers arranged in spikes, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from the typical form of Melampyrum laxum.
